thread.title: 7 Tricks To Upgrade Your Apartment With Removable Wallpaper
thread.title_full: 7 Tricks To Upgrade Your Apartment With Removable Wallpaper

author: Erin Phraner, Nifty, Chelsea Evers
title: 7 Tricks To Upgrade Your Apartment With Removable Wallpaper
text:
View this image ›
BuzzFeed ID: 10637890 2. 1. Work from the top down. View this image ›
BuzzFeed Order a removable wallpaper you love (we used this one ) and start your project at the top red or top left corner of your space.
ID: 10637920 3. 2. Don’t use stripe or grid patterns on old walls (they’re usually uneven). View this image ›
BuzzFeed AKA good luck trying to get those lines to match up…
ID: 10637892 4. 3. Smooth from the center out. View this image ›
BuzzFeed It’s the best way to avoid air bubbles.
ID: 10637895 5. 4. Trim the edges with a utility knife. View this image ›
BuzzFeed Scissors aren’t your friend. Unless you’re, like, CRAZY good at cutting straight lines.
ID: 10637896 6. 5. Un-peel panels to fix any mistakes. View this image ›
BuzzFeed Literally foolproof. We place, un-peeled and redid a few panels 5+ times and they never lost their stickiness.
ID: 10637898 7. 6. Remove air bubbles using a pin. View this image ›
BuzzFeed No one will ever know.
ID: 10637900 8. 7. Work in 6” to 8” sections. View this image ›
BuzzFeed For your sanity but also for the best end result!
ID: 10637904 9. If you want the same wallpaper we used in this video, check out Chasing Paper for this pattern and more. View this image ›
BuzzFeed ID: 10637905 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
